title: Lagoon Layer Banandium Gem locations in Donkey Kong Bananza
description: Banandium Gems are golden bananas scattered around the layers in Donkey Kong Bananza. You’ll find dozens of these collectibles in the Lagoon Layer. The Lagoon Layer is home to, well, a lagoon, and to the wise Kong Elder. Some of the Banandium Gems in the this layer will require you to adjust the water level […]
author: gio-colantonio
excerpt: Collect the Golden Bananas in the Lagoon Layer
text: Banandium Gems are golden bananas scattered around the layers in Donkey Kong Bananza. You’ll find dozens of these collectibles in the Lagoon Layer.The Lagoon Layer is home to, well, a lagoon, and to the wise Kong Elder. Some of the Banandium Gems in the this layer will require you to adjust the water level of the lagoon and utilize your Kong Bananza powers. The Lagoon Layer is said to have 55 Banandium Gems in the collection menu, but a chunk of them cannot be found until you progress further into the game. These Banandium Gems can be fairly difficult to find — some are hidden inside Ancient Ruins, while others require you to think on your feet.Below, we list where to find all of the Banandium Gems in the Lagoon Layer we’ve found so far in Donkey Kong Bananza. We’re still updating this guide and will add more golden bananas as we find them.Table of ContentsLagoon Layer Sublayer 100 Banandium GemsLagoon Layer Sublayer 101 Banandium GemsLagoon Layer Sublayer 102 Banandium GemsLagoon Layer Sublayer 100 Banandium GemsWe’ve found 23 Banandium Gems in Sublayer 100 of the Lagoon layer.#1: First Crockoid Cracked!Graphic: Johnny Yu/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via PolygonThe first Banandium Gem will appear immediately in front of you when you first land in the sublayer.#2: Cave by the CapeGraphic: Johnny Yu/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via PolygonFrom the starting point, walk forward along the right edge until you run into a wall. Hop over the wall and drop down. In the center of the area, you’ll find a soft dirt wall. Punch through the wall and head inside to find the second Banandium Gem.#3: ???The third Banandium Gem is skipped over in the collection, so we believe that you’ll need to return after you’ve progressed further or after you’ve beaten the main story of Donkey Kong Bananza.#4: Bathing BananaGraphic: Johnny Yu/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via PolygonFollow the road from the Reservoir Bank tuning fork. Look up to your right around halfway down the path and you’ll see a dirt wall. Smash through it, drop into some water, and smash the gem.#5: Shifty Smash: Beyond the WallGraphic: Johnny Yu/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via PolygonFollow the road from the Reservoir Bank tuning fork, and instead of turning left toward the rotating concrete doors, climb the grassy cliffs. On the other side, above the entrance to Sublayer 101, you’ll see a shifty triangle, which looks like shiny silver pyramid. Break the triangle to start a timed event where you need to demolish a cube on the other side of the cliff in 20 seconds. Do that, and the Banandium Gem will appear.To easily complete this challenge, we recommend breaking the wall behind the triangle before you even start the challenge. After you start the challenge, break off a chunk of the bomb rock and throw it at the shifty cube to finish the challenge.#6: Battle: Stoney, Grassy GoonsGraphic: Johnny Yu/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via PolygonFollow the main walking path that starts at the Reservoir Bank tuning fork. You’ll find an Ancient Rune entrance on the right, containing a battle against three Crockoids. Defeat them to get the gem.#7: A Nook behind ConcreteGraphic: Johnny Yu/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via PolygonBetween the rotating concrete walls and the waterfall on the other side is a small concrete panel with gold sparks coming off it. Throw a bomb rock at it to shatter the panel, and the Gem is in a niche behind it.#8: Battle: Both Sides of the BridgeGraphic: Johnny Yu/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via PolygonThis gem can be obtained in the Ancient Ruin next to the Reservoir Hills tuning fork. Defeat six Antickoids to get it.#9: Smash Through the FloorGraphic: Johnny Yu/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via PolygonYou’ll find a giant cave shaped like a monkey head behind the giant waterfall in the center of the map. Go inside, climb the ceiling, and punch the enemy when it’s right above the destructible floor spot. Jump into the cave inside to get the gem.#10: Cranky’s Lagoon RantGraphic: Johnny Yu/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via PolygonBehind the giant cave shaped like a monkey head in the center of the map, you’ll find Rambi the rhinoceros. Toss stone chunks at the shifty objects floating near him to form platforms. Jump on them until you reach Cranky Kong and talk to him to get the tenth Banandium Gem.#11: A Real MouthfulGraphic: Johnny Yu/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via PolygonGo to the mouth of the monkey head-shaped cliff behind the giant central waterfall. Punch into the dirt surface to find a gem.#12: Rest Stop on Roof Road1/2Graphic: Johnny Yu/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via PolygonThis gem appears in the Ancient Ruin containing the Hangin’ on the Roof Road challenge, located above Reservoir Hills’ tuning fork. Follow the main path and you’ll find it midway through the level.#13: Hidden on the Roof RoadGraphic: Johnny Yu/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via PolygonBefore reaching the exit of Hangin’ on the Roof Road, follow the roof path to the left. Punch the moving stone slabs to open a path to the hidden area at the back, which takes to you to a gem hidden behind a smashable wall.#14: At the End of Roof RoadGraphic: Johnny Yu/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via PolygonComplete the Hangin’ on the Roof Road Ancient Ruin and this gem will be waiting for you at the exit.#15: Lakeside Low RoadGraphic: Johnny Yu/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via PolygonHead to the entrance to the pond area just behind the Hangin’ on the Roof Road Ancient Ruin. Before walking on the bridge, turn around and drop down to a ledge next to the cliff wall. You’ll find two green barrels sitting next to a stone wall. Smash through that wall to find a gem inside.#16: Battle: Swarms among the PillarsGraphic: Johnny Yu/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via PolygonIn the area behind the Hangin’ on the Roof Road Ancient Ruin, hop into the water to find a cave opening along the back wall. Head inside of the opening and out the other side to find an Ancient Ruin. Go inside and defeat 50 Peekaboopoids to get the Banandium Gem.#17: Follow the Voided Terrain1/2Graphic: Johnny Yu/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via PolygonThere’s a small opening on the ground right before the area with floating green pipe. Drop down and you’ll see a gem shielded by purple material. Smash through the dirt wall near it and follow the purple path on the floor until you reach an object you can open by singing. Punch it to get rid of the purple material and head back to claim your gem.#18: Fishin’ for BananasGraphic: Johnny Yu/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via PolygonHead to the edge of the map behind the floating pipe. If you look off of the edge, you’ll see a platform that you can drop onto. Land on the paltform and walk into the cave to find a couple fishing monkeys and a sunken Banandium Gem. Jump off of their fishing platform and dive punch the sunken gem a few times to retrieve it.If you do this after letting water back into Sublayer 101, the Banandium Gem will be on dry ground.#19: Rise and RinseGraphic: Johnny Yu/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via PolygonGo to the pond below the floating green pipe structure. You’ll find a platform with a blue punching bag attached to it in the water. Punch it enough times to raise a platform with a gem on it from the center of the pond.#20: Placed in a PipeGraphic: Johnny Yu/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via PolygonClimb to the top of the floating pipe structure and follow it until you see an opening you can climb into. Head inside to find a hidden gem.#21: Shifty Smash: Atop the PipesGraphic: Johnny Yu/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via PolygonOn top of the pipes, and in the center of the swirl, is another shifty triangle. Punch it to start a timed trial, where you need to correctly aim barrel cannon blasts to launch through obstacles. Clear them all in 20 seconds to get this Banandium Gem.#22: Battle: Wings on the Wobbly DiscGraphic: Johnny Yu/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via PolygonWhen you reach the area with the floating green pipe, turn left to find a dirt wall. Break the wall and head inside to find an Ancient Ruin. Hop inside and defeat the three Buzzoids to get the gem.#23: Beyond the Cloudy PlatformsGraphic: Johnny Yu/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via PolygonFrom the Ancient Ruin with the Buzzoids, head to the other side of the area with the floating green pipe and walk to the edge of the layer. You’ll find two shifty platforms and a moving platform with a Banandium Gem on it. Throw any material at the shifty platforms and walk across to collect your gem.#24: Blasting for the BananaGraphic: Johnny Yu/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via PolygonJust below Cranky Kong’s floating island, you’ll find a cave with a metal platform that you can dive punch. Dive punch the platform to set off an explosion that’ll reveal a Banandium Gem across from you, but be careful of the mines in the water!Lagoon Layer Sublayer 101 Banandium GemsWe’ve found 14 Banandium Gems in Sublayer 101 of the Lagoon Layer.#26: Landed in Salvager’s Landing!Graphic: Julia Lee/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via PolygonDefeat the Crockoid sub-boss circling the central waterfall of Sublayer 100 and punch the stake. Drop down to Sublayer 101 and the gem will be there when you land.#27: Shifty Smash: A Wall Hanging in the AirGraphic: Julia Lee/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via PolygonOnce you enter the Sublayer from the waterfall entrance in Sublayer 100, turn around. You’ll see a green platform with a shifty triangle on it. Chunk jump over to it or climb up to the platform and punch the triangle. You’ll have 20 seconds to blow up a concrete wall with boom rock, earning you a gem.#28: On the Ceiling of the FloorGraphic: Julia Lee/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via PolygonOnce you’ve raised the water level in the area, swim underneath the village. You can now reach a gem hanging underneath the Thorn-Choked Conveyor Ruins.#29: Over the Thorny Path1/2Graphic: Julia Lee/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via PolygonHead to the Thorn-Choked Conveyor Ancient Ruin located just past the Sublayer 101 entrance you access by dropping down from Sublayer 100’s central waterfall. Follow the linear path and you’ll get your first gem midway through the challenge.#30: Into the Thorny NookGraphic: Julia Lee/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via PolygonContinue through Thorn-Choked Conveyor, past the first gem, until you see a patch in the left wall covered by thorns. Bomb rock your way through it to find a hidden gem.#31: Through the Thorny WallsGraphic: Julia Lee/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via PolygonComplete Thorn-Choked Conveyor and you’ll find the final gem right at the exit barrel.#32: The Salvager’s StashGraphic: Julia Lee/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via PolygonWhen you enter the village, look to the right of the clothing vendor. You’ll see a green structure. There’s an opening on the side of it that will take you to an underground cavern with a gem inside.#33: Battle: Concrete-Wall ClashGraphic: Julia Lee/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via PolygonFrom the starting area accessed by dropping down the waterfall hole in Sublayer 100, immedietly go to the left. Go inside the ruin and fight two Crockoids to get the gem.#34: Up, Over, and AcrossGraphic: Julia Lee/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via PolygonAfter filling up the water by breaking the first pipe, drop down to the bottom of the level and go to stone platform on the west side of the map. Scale the wall and climb across the roof road. The gem will be on the other side.#35: Within the Fast-Growing GrassGraphic: Julia Lee/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via PolygonAfter fully filling up the water in the area, head to the yellow mossy island floating under banana #34. You’ll now be able to reach a road on the roof. Climb across it to reach a gem.#36: Hangin’ on Orangu-Hang Highway!Graphic: Julia Lee/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via PolygonGo to the back corner of Sublayer 100 and punch the stake sitting on a cliff, as part of the game’s main story. Jump down the hole and the gem will be down below when you land in Sublayer 101.#37: Concrete Wall on the Moving FloorGraphic: Julia Lee/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via PolygonDrop into Sublayer 101 from the Sublayer 100 entrance at Water Tank Hill. Follow the ceiling path until you reach a platform with a boom rock monster. Turn back towards the ceiling road and you’ll see a concrete wall that can be blown up. Take a chunk off the monster to blow it up, and chunk jump up to get inside the now opened tunnel. There’s another concrete wall in here on the side, which you can toss a boom rock at to reveal a gem.#38: Outskirts of the Fishing VillageGraphic: Julia Lee/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via PolygonDrop down into Sublayer 101 using the entrance in Reservoir Outskirts in Sublayer 100, on the edge of the map. You’ll drop in front of a climable roof that leads to a gem.#39: Crossed to the Kong Elder’s Court!Graphic: Julia Lee/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via PolygonOnce you get to the Sublayer, follow the main quest by blowing up two pipes to raise the water level. That will create a bridge you can walk across to reach the level’s elder and a gem.#40: The Ship Stern’s SnackGraphic: Julia Lee/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via PolygonWhen you reach the Elder Court, head to the back right side of the shipping container wall. Follow that edge to the back of the containers and you’ll find a gem around the corner atop a platform on the water.Lagoon Layer Sublayer 102 Banandium GemsWe’ve found five Banandium Gems found in Sublayer 102 of the Lagoon Layer.#40-50: ???Banandium Gems 40 through 50 have been skipped in the collection. We believe that you’ll need to progress further or complete the main story of Donkey Kong Bananza before you can find these Banandium Gems.#51: Dropped into Chimpy Channel!Graphic: Julia Lee/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via PolygonComplete the main story quest of Sublayer 101, earning the first Bananza power and smashing through the shipping container maze. You’ll reach an entrance to Sublayer 102 at the end and a gem will be there when you jump down.#52: Pop and Destroy1/2Graphic: Julia Lee/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via PolygonEnter the Ancient Ruin at the start of the area. Collect all the balloons to complete the challenge and spawn a gem back at the entrance.#53: Atop the Concrete RoofGraphic: Julia Lee/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via PolygonWhen inside Lagoon Layer Challenge Course 3, climb to the top of the maze. There’s a gem up there!#54: Hung from the CeilingGraphic: Julia Lee/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via PolygonUpon entering the maze, head to the right. You’ll be able to climb a wall near the edge of the maze that will take you up to a climable ceiling path that ends at a gem.#55: Shipwrecked TreasureGraphic: Julia Lee/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via PolygonWalk to the wall opposite the Ancient Ruin. Punch through it and you’ll come out to an area with a small ship. There’s a gem inside of it.
html:
Banandium Gems are golden bananas scattered around the layers in Donkey Kong Bananza. You’ll find dozens of these collectibles in the Lagoon Layer.

The Lagoon Layer is home to, well, a lagoon, and to the wise Kong Elder. Some of the Banandium Gems in the this layer will require you to adjust the water level of the lagoon and utilize your Kong Bananza powers. The Lagoon Layer is said to have 55 Banandium Gems in the collection menu, but a chunk of them cannot be found until you progress further into the game. These Banandium Gems can be fairly difficult to find — some are hidden inside Ancient Ruins, while others require you to think on your feet.

Below, we list where to find all of the Banandium Gems in the Lagoon Layer we’ve found so far in Donkey Kong Bananza. We’re still updating this guide and will add more golden bananas as we find them.

Table of Contents

  • Lagoon Layer Sublayer 100 Banandium Gems
  • Lagoon Layer Sublayer 101 Banandium Gems
  • Lagoon Layer Sublayer 102 Banandium Gems

Lagoon Layer Sublayer 100 Banandium Gems

We’ve found 23 Banandium Gems in Sublayer 100 of the Lagoon layer.

#1: First Crockoid Cracked!

Graphic: Johnny Yu/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via Polygon

The first Banandium Gem will appear immediately in front of you when you first land in the sublayer.

#2: Cave by the Cape

Graphic: Johnny Yu/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via Polygon

From the starting point, walk forward along the right edge until you run into a wall. Hop over the wall and drop down. In the center of the area, you’ll find a soft dirt wall. Punch through the wall and head inside to find the second Banandium Gem.

#3: ???

The third Banandium Gem is skipped over in the collection, so we believe that you’ll need to return after you’ve progressed further or after you’ve beaten the main story of Donkey Kong Bananza.

#4: Bathing Banana

Graphic: Johnny Yu/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via Polygon

Follow the road from the Reservoir Bank tuning fork. Look up to your right around halfway down the path and you’ll see a dirt wall. Smash through it, drop into some water, and smash the gem.

#5: Shifty Smash: Beyond the Wall

Graphic: Johnny Yu/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via Polygon

Follow the road from the Reservoir Bank tuning fork, and instead of turning left toward the rotating concrete doors, climb the grassy cliffs. On the other side, above the entrance to Sublayer 101, you’ll see a shifty triangle, which looks like shiny silver pyramid. Break the triangle to start a timed event where you need to demolish a cube on the other side of the cliff in 20 seconds. Do that, and the Banandium Gem will appear.

To easily complete this challenge, we recommend breaking the wall behind the triangle before you even start the challenge. After you start the challenge, break off a chunk of the bomb rock and throw it at the shifty cube to finish the challenge.

#6: Battle: Stoney, Grassy Goons

Graphic: Johnny Yu/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via Polygon

Follow the main walking path that starts at the Reservoir Bank tuning fork. You’ll find an Ancient Rune entrance on the right, containing a battle against three Crockoids. Defeat them to get the gem.

#7: A Nook behind Concrete

Graphic: Johnny Yu/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via Polygon

Between the rotating concrete walls and the waterfall on the other side is a small concrete panel with gold sparks coming off it. Throw a bomb rock at it to shatter the panel, and the Gem is in a niche behind it.

#8: Battle: Both Sides of the Bridge

Graphic: Johnny Yu/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via Polygon

This gem can be obtained in the Ancient Ruin next to the Reservoir Hills tuning fork. Defeat six Antickoids to get it.

#9: Smash Through the Floor

Graphic: Johnny Yu/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via Polygon

You’ll find a giant cave shaped like a monkey head behind the giant waterfall in the center of the map. Go inside, climb the ceiling, and punch the enemy when it’s right above the destructible floor spot. Jump into the cave inside to get the gem.

#10: Cranky’s Lagoon Rant

Graphic: Johnny Yu/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via Polygon

Behind the giant cave shaped like a monkey head in the center of the map, you’ll find Rambi the rhinoceros. Toss stone chunks at the shifty objects floating near him to form platforms. Jump on them until you reach Cranky Kong and talk to him to get the tenth Banandium Gem.

#11: A Real Mouthful

Graphic: Johnny Yu/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via Polygon

Go to the mouth of the monkey head-shaped cliff behind the giant central waterfall. Punch into the dirt surface to find a gem.

#12: Rest Stop on Roof Road

1/2Graphic: Johnny Yu/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via Polygon

This gem appears in the Ancient Ruin containing the Hangin’ on the Roof Road challenge, located above Reservoir Hills’ tuning fork. Follow the main path and you’ll find it midway through the level.

#13: Hidden on the Roof Road

Graphic: Johnny Yu/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via Polygon

Before reaching the exit of Hangin’ on the Roof Road, follow the roof path to the left. Punch the moving stone slabs to open a path to the hidden area at the back, which takes to you to a gem hidden behind a smashable wall.

#14: At the End of Roof Road

Graphic: Johnny Yu/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via Polygon

Complete the Hangin’ on the Roof Road Ancient Ruin and this gem will be waiting for you at the exit.

#15: Lakeside Low Road

Graphic: Johnny Yu/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via Polygon

Head to the entrance to the pond area just behind the Hangin’ on the Roof Road Ancient Ruin. Before walking on the bridge, turn around and drop down to a ledge next to the cliff wall. You’ll find two green barrels sitting next to a stone wall. Smash through that wall to find a gem inside.

#16: Battle: Swarms among the Pillars

Graphic: Johnny Yu/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via Polygon

In the area behind the Hangin’ on the Roof Road Ancient Ruin, hop into the water to find a cave opening along the back wall. Head inside of the opening and out the other side to find an Ancient Ruin. Go inside and defeat 50 Peekaboopoids to get the Banandium Gem.

#17: Follow the Voided Terrain

1/2Graphic: Johnny Yu/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via Polygon

There’s a small opening on the ground right before the area with floating green pipe. Drop down and you’ll see a gem shielded by purple material. Smash through the dirt wall near it and follow the purple path on the floor until you reach an object you can open by singing. Punch it to get rid of the purple material and head back to claim your gem.

#18: Fishin’ for Bananas

Graphic: Johnny Yu/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via Polygon

Head to the edge of the map behind the floating pipe. If you look off of the edge, you’ll see a platform that you can drop onto. Land on the paltform and walk into the cave to find a couple fishing monkeys and a sunken Banandium Gem. Jump off of their fishing platform and dive punch the sunken gem a few times to retrieve it.

If you do this after letting water back into Sublayer 101, the Banandium Gem will be on dry ground.

#19: Rise and Rinse

Graphic: Johnny Yu/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via Polygon

Go to the pond below the floating green pipe structure. You’ll find a platform with a blue punching bag attached to it in the water. Punch it enough times to raise a platform with a gem on it from the center of the pond.

#20: Placed in a Pipe

Graphic: Johnny Yu/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via Polygon

Climb to the top of the floating pipe structure and follow it until you see an opening you can climb into. Head inside to find a hidden gem.

#21: Shifty Smash: Atop the Pipes

Graphic: Johnny Yu/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via Polygon

On top of the pipes, and in the center of the swirl, is another shifty triangle. Punch it to start a timed trial, where you need to correctly aim barrel cannon blasts to launch through obstacles. Clear them all in 20 seconds to get this Banandium Gem.

#22: Battle: Wings on the Wobbly Disc

Graphic: Johnny Yu/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via Polygon

When you reach the area with the floating green pipe, turn left to find a dirt wall. Break the wall and head inside to find an Ancient Ruin. Hop inside and defeat the three Buzzoids to get the gem.

#23: Beyond the Cloudy Platforms

Graphic: Johnny Yu/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via Polygon

From the Ancient Ruin with the Buzzoids, head to the other side of the area with the floating green pipe and walk to the edge of the layer. You’ll find two shifty platforms and a moving platform with a Banandium Gem on it. Throw any material at the shifty platforms and walk across to collect your gem.

#24: Blasting for the Banana

Graphic: Johnny Yu/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via Polygon

Just below Cranky Kong’s floating island, you’ll find a cave with a metal platform that you can dive punch. Dive punch the platform to set off an explosion that’ll reveal a Banandium Gem across from you, but be careful of the mines in the water!

Lagoon Layer Sublayer 101 Banandium Gems

We’ve found 14 Banandium Gems in Sublayer 101 of the Lagoon Layer.

#26: Landed in Salvager’s Landing!

Graphic: Julia Lee/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via Polygon

Defeat the Crockoid sub-boss circling the central waterfall of Sublayer 100 and punch the stake. Drop down to Sublayer 101 and the gem will be there when you land.

#27: Shifty Smash: A Wall Hanging in the Air

Graphic: Julia Lee/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via Polygon

Once you enter the Sublayer from the waterfall entrance in Sublayer 100, turn around. You’ll see a green platform with a shifty triangle on it. Chunk jump over to it or climb up to the platform and punch the triangle. You’ll have 20 seconds to blow up a concrete wall with boom rock, earning you a gem.

#28: On the Ceiling of the Floor

Graphic: Julia Lee/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via Polygon

Once you’ve raised the water level in the area, swim underneath the village. You can now reach a gem hanging underneath the Thorn-Choked Conveyor Ruins.

#29: Over the Thorny Path

1/2Graphic: Julia Lee/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via Polygon

Head to the Thorn-Choked Conveyor Ancient Ruin located just past the Sublayer 101 entrance you access by dropping down from Sublayer 100’s central waterfall. Follow the linear path and you’ll get your first gem midway through the challenge.

#30: Into the Thorny Nook

Graphic: Julia Lee/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via Polygon

Continue through Thorn-Choked Conveyor, past the first gem, until you see a patch in the left wall covered by thorns. Bomb rock your way through it to find a hidden gem.

#31: Through the Thorny Walls

Graphic: Julia Lee/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via Polygon

Complete Thorn-Choked Conveyor and you’ll find the final gem right at the exit barrel.

#32: The Salvager’s Stash

Graphic: Julia Lee/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via Polygon

When you enter the village, look to the right of the clothing vendor. You’ll see a green structure. There’s an opening on the side of it that will take you to an underground cavern with a gem inside.

#33: Battle: Concrete-Wall Clash

Graphic: Julia Lee/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via Polygon

From the starting area accessed by dropping down the waterfall hole in Sublayer 100, immedietly go to the left. Go inside the ruin and fight two Crockoids to get the gem.

#34: Up, Over, and Across

Graphic: Julia Lee/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via Polygon

After filling up the water by breaking the first pipe, drop down to the bottom of the level and go to stone platform on the west side of the map. Scale the wall and climb across the roof road. The gem will be on the other side.

#35: Within the Fast-Growing Grass

Graphic: Julia Lee/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via Polygon

After fully filling up the water in the area, head to the yellow mossy island floating under banana #34. You’ll now be able to reach a road on the roof. Climb across it to reach a gem.

#36: Hangin’ on Orangu-Hang Highway!

Graphic: Julia Lee/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via Polygon

Go to the back corner of Sublayer 100 and punch the stake sitting on a cliff, as part of the game’s main story. Jump down the hole and the gem will be down below when you land in Sublayer 101.

#37: Concrete Wall on the Moving Floor

Graphic: Julia Lee/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via Polygon

Drop into Sublayer 101 from the Sublayer 100 entrance at Water Tank Hill. Follow the ceiling path until you reach a platform with a boom rock monster. Turn back towards the ceiling road and you’ll see a concrete wall that can be blown up. Take a chunk off the monster to blow it up, and chunk jump up to get inside the now opened tunnel. There’s another concrete wall in here on the side, which you can toss a boom rock at to reveal a gem.

#38: Outskirts of the Fishing Village

Graphic: Julia Lee/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via Polygon

Drop down into Sublayer 101 using the entrance in Reservoir Outskirts in Sublayer 100, on the edge of the map. You’ll drop in front of a climable roof that leads to a gem.

#39: Crossed to the Kong Elder’s Court!

Graphic: Julia Lee/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via Polygon

Once you get to the Sublayer, follow the main quest by blowing up two pipes to raise the water level. That will create a bridge you can walk across to reach the level’s elder and a gem.

#40: The Ship Stern’s Snack

Graphic: Julia Lee/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via Polygon

When you reach the Elder Court, head to the back right side of the shipping container wall. Follow that edge to the back of the containers and you’ll find a gem around the corner atop a platform on the water.

Lagoon Layer Sublayer 102 Banandium Gems

We’ve found five Banandium Gems found in Sublayer 102 of the Lagoon Layer.

#40-50: ???

Banandium Gems 40 through 50 have been skipped in the collection. We believe that you’ll need to progress further or complete the main story of Donkey Kong Bananza before you can find these Banandium Gems.

#51: Dropped into Chimpy Channel!

Graphic: Julia Lee/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via Polygon

Complete the main story quest of Sublayer 101, earning the first Bananza power and smashing through the shipping container maze. You’ll reach an entrance to Sublayer 102 at the end and a gem will be there when you jump down.

#52: Pop and Destroy

1/2Graphic: Julia Lee/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via Polygon

Enter the Ancient Ruin at the start of the area. Collect all the balloons to complete the challenge and spawn a gem back at the entrance.

#53: Atop the Concrete Roof

Graphic: Julia Lee/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via Polygon

When inside Lagoon Layer Challenge Course 3, climb to the top of the maze. There’s a gem up there!

#54: Hung from the Ceiling

Graphic: Julia Lee/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via Polygon

Upon entering the maze, head to the right. You’ll be able to climb a wall near the edge of the maze that will take you up to a climable ceiling path that ends at a gem.

#55: Shipwrecked Treasure

Graphic: Julia Lee/Polygon | Source images: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via Polygon

Walk to the wall opposite the Ancient Ruin. Punch through it and you’ll come out to an area with a small ship. There’s a gem inside of it.
